column2: I am a fictional British character.
column3: I have been in existence since 1887.
column4: I exhibit astute logical reasoning, I can adopt many disguises and I use forensic science.
column5: I am a consulting detective who has beem in 4 novels and 56 short stories with my friend and medical biographer.
column6: Currently, two televeision shows have adapted the stories of me into modern retellings.

column2: I am a fictional British character who has appeared in books, television, radio, comic strip, video games and film.
column3: I have been portrayed by 13 different male actors.
column4: I first appeared in a 1953 novel that has been adapted to film in recent years.
column5: One of my catchphrases has been voted as the "best-loved one-liner in cinema" and a "signature introduction [that] would become the most famous and loved film line ever."
column6: I am also known by my three-digit code number at the Secret Intelligence Service, or MI6.
column7: You don't seem nervous!  You should be more shaken and not stirred,

column2: I was born in London, England but I'm prominently known for my Australian career.
column3: I have a Bachelor of Exonomics and a Bachelor of Laws from the University of Sydney, and a Master of Arts in Philosophy, Politics and Economics as a Rhodes Scholar at The Queen's College, Oxford.  I trained as a Roman Catholic seminarian, before becoming a journalist, business manager and political advisor.
column4: Between 1992 and 1994 I was the Director of Australians for Constitutional Monarchy.
column5: I'm the 28th person in Australia to work in the position in which I currently work.
column6: I am an Australian politician and the 10th Chairperson-in-office of the Commonwealth of Nations.
column7: Being successful isn't all a political struggle

column2: I am a male character best known by my honorific and surname.  (NOTE: Honorific = Mr/Master/Mrs/Ms)  When guessing who I am, please ONLY type my surname!  DO NOT type the honorific!
column3: I am the greedy owner of a very successful business.
column4: My former best friend, but current rival, is a fierce competitor of mine.
column5: I have a very close-guarded trade secret that is a great contributor to the success of my business that my competitor would do anything to get his hands on.
